answers.answer: Hi,How is your grand daughter? I'm sorry to hear what she has been through for the last 2 years. What tests were done already? Imaging and neurological tests are important in determining the underlying cause. A second opinion from other neurologists or further evaluation  may help also to rule out neurological or immunological issues. Hang on and stay positive.  Take care and do keep us posted.

question: My grandaughter is 21 and for the past 2 years has had all kinds of symtoms and  been diagnosed with many diseases including diabetes. After a year of tingling limbs migraines , MRSA  she got up one morning and was paralyzed from the waist down. All tests come back negative including MS. She is in therapy however in my mind the docs have given up on her. She has been diagnosed as disease free, She has reflexes which baffle the doctors and this condition has caused her to withdraw from school .
title: Patralyzed and Undiagnosed
